body: • In early editions we said the head of the Unite union, Len McCluskey, had predicted that Labour would lose council seats in Scotland and Wales in this week’s elections. Local government elections are being held in England only. Elections in Scotland and Wales are for the parliament and national assembly respectively (McCluskey attacks ‘treacherous’ Labour MPs, 2 May, page 1). • An article about a government report recommending that workers, not their employers, should keep tips said that Pizza Express and Giraffe would stop taking a percentage of tips paid by card (Minister reveals proposals to help workers keep tips, 2 May, page 21). In fact, both companies say they have already stopped doing so. • The Birthdays column (2 May, page 33) said Dawn Primarolo was a dame when she is now Lady Primarolo. She was made a DBE in the Queen’s birthday honours list in 2014 but was then given a peerage in 2015. • Homophone corner: “… those who believed they had no interest in the exhibition inside could take a peak nonetheless” (The rebellious type, 30 April, page 16, Review). • Other recently corrected articles include: Labour criticises Sats changes as parents plan ‘kids’ strike’ over exams Berta Cáceres murder: four men arrested over Honduran activist’s death
